Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Carlton W. Werkau Papers
Werkau, Carlton W.
Quinn, John L.
WAG.309
0.5 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript box.
1950-1955 Materials are in English 1
Historical/Biographical Note
Carlton W. Werkau served as the Secretary-Treasurer for the Communications Workers of America (CWA) from 1943 until his death in 1955.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of photographs, both personal and union related, correspondence, and CWA records. The CWA records consist of Convention proceedings from 1953-1955 as well as a strike manual and tax files. Articles and letters concerning Werkau's death in 1955 are also included.
Use Restrictions
Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by Carlton Werkau was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Custodial History
A relative of Carlton W. Werkau sent these papers to the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) Regional Office in Winston-Salem, NC. The collection was later transferred from the NLRB to The Communications Workers of America (CWA), where Werkau had served as Secretary-Treasurer from 1943-1955.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by John L. Quinn, Communications Workers of America District Counsel, in 2010. The accession number associated with this gift is 2010.011.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Carlton W. Werkau Papers; WAG 309; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Quinn, John L.
